title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: The usual, HR screen, phone, Zoom meeting. Took about a month after applying before I heard anything. Pay is really bad. It might be okay for the residential campus in Fayette, but some of these centers are in large metropolitan areas and the pay scale does not reflect that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Upper Iowa University?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview procedure was fine. They said they will contact me in next week, but I actually waited more than 3 weeks. The interview questions were typical. Salary offer was much less than what was expected for the required task.
Interview Questions: What would you say is your greatest strength?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (New Orleans, LA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was not bad, I was interviewed by multiple people & it went well. Starting salary is not enough for the tasks they want done. I also think that they should explain the duties more in depth so you know what you’re getting into
Interview Questions: How are you with multitasking

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Des Moines, IA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick and straightforward. Lots of questions as dictated by their HR policies. Online interview first, then campus visit. The campus visit was not the best; usually people take you out for lunch/dinner.
Interview Questions: How do I plan on recruiting students?

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: They had me introduce myself first, and the committee members introduced themself. We had 30 mins interview. I did not remember how many questions they asked me, about 4-5 questions.
Interview Questions: One assignment from the class.

title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, one Zoom interview, and a final in-person interview.  The phone process was with one person.  The Zoom was with two people.  The last one had three.  It went rather smoothly.
Interview Questions: Why did I pick Upper Iowa as a possibility for employment?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, friendly staff members and interviewer was patient and good and accommodating. The whole process was quick and easy. Not too much difficulties, and hard questions. Could start almost immediately, once HR has done paperwork for you and after you sign it.
Interview Questions: What dates could you work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online. Had one in-person interview. During the interview, there are 3 people, one of them is on Zoom. The questions they asked are very common, such as describing how I'm organized.
Interview Questions: Please rate your technology proficiency.

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Fairly quick process. initial phone call lasts about 20-30 minutes. Takes about a week to hear back if you get moved to the next round or not.  At this point you get scheduled for a zoom interview for the next round. if that goes well you will get an on-campus interview based on the position/role. Overall a very smooth process. Hiring committee is easy to work with and get back to in a timely fashion.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with derogatory language/comments within the facility?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple interview process. Spoke with 3 current employees and discussed duties of position and how I would handle certain situations. I was able to ask them questions regarding the position and how my skills would apply.
Interview Questions: How do I work with others

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Alvin, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Video virtual conference held with me and my future supervisor.  I then had another second phone interview.  The atmosphere was very casual  and I felt as ease during the process.
Interview Questions: What is the most stressful situation encountered in teaching?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: I participated in a 30 minute interview that was conducted by the director and a panel of her choosing that was made up of adjunct faculty members and other personell.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were faced with a challenging situation and failed?

title: Business Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: You apply online, through the Human Resources office, and sometimes it can take a few months to get any reply, wether its for an interview or not. You may interview in a group, mine had three people. The interview was relaxed and it was easy to talk to the interviewers, I just wish the process wouldn't take so long.
Interview Questions: Time management, why do you want to work in a college.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: Accepts application through email.  Process is long.  There is little communication from Upper Iowa University prior to interview.  Contact name for application is Human Resource Department office-level staff member.  Committee reviews cover letters and resumes.  Each ranks by experience and skills in job descriptions.  Group interview.  Each applicant asked same questions.
Interview Questions: Interview questions based upon job description.  What experiences do you have in _____?  Give an example.

title: Online Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: Easy and well organized.  People were pleasant and gave clear instructions of their wants and needs.  There were no unexpected questions. The pay was a lesser than I initially planned.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Upper Iowa University?

title: Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fine, typical questions, organization just greatly undervalued the role.  The job offer dollar amount was a significantly lower amount than expected for work that would be required.  Interviewers were nice, and new what they were looking for, explained the role well.  I think the University was just in a spot where they needed the person, but didn't want to pay for the experience or education (which seemed a bit counter-intuitive based on the role).  The benefits were good, and it appeared that it would be an excellent place to work, it just didn't pay enough for what they were asking the person to do.
Interview Questions: When they asked if I could handle the drive to Fayette.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I did a conference call phone interview with the Director of Admissions and Assistant Dean of Enrollment. From there, I did an in person interview where I was asked to give a presentation on UIU and a separate person to person interview.
Interview Questions:
If you were a brick on a wall, what brick would you be? 
Do you like to eat alone?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple and straightforward. I was asked to submit a CV, and resume. The persons involved in interviewing and contracting were pleasant. Training was good. I did not feel that anything was left out in that regard.
Interview Questions: If I had any teaching experience in my field

title: Mathematics Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Milwaukee, WI) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Director in his office for a face-to-face interview at a time that was the most convenient for me.  Very cordial and well organized.  I was made to feel very welcome.
Interview Questions: What types of math courses have I taught over the years and what methods do I presently use to teach them.

title: Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Spent days getting there and back.  Fly, then drive, then stay.  People were generally likable, but that does not mean much.  They were far too full of themselves.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University (Fayette, IA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: They seemed to have already decided when I got there on another candidate.
Interview Questions: None

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Upper Iowa University
Interview Descriptions: The usual, HR screen, phone, Zoom meeting. Took about a month after applying before I heard anything. Pay is really bad. It might be okay for the residential campus in Fayette, but some of these centers are in large metropolitan areas and the pay scale does not reflect that.
